item.title: picoCTF2017 task 5 keyz
item.description:
picoCTF2017 task 5 keyz

[link—standalone]

fuck. this was insane. so, i had to create my ssh keys on my local system using
ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "normalguyincollege@gmail.com"
and then open the shell on the ctf website. then navigate to cd ~/.ssh/
create a file called as authorized keys, add my ssh rsa key there.
again come to my local machine, and then ssh into the server using ssh thenerdsuperuser@shell2017.picoctf.com
finally the key was shown: who_needs_pwords_anyways

item.title: picoCTF2017 task 4
item.description:
picoCTF2017 task 4

[link—standalone]

now i had a list of puzzles to solve. i took the cryptography section and took one named as substitution
it was a simple substitution cipher. the keys were, MIT=THE RTETDZTK=DECEMBER
here is the link to the file.
the flag here was, IFONLYMODERNCRYPTOWASLIKETHIS

item.title: picoCTF2017 task 3
item.description:
picoCTF2017 task 3

[link—standalone]

third one was pretty simple. i had a couple of hexadecimal codes and i had to find which one is red(meh).
here is the link.

the answer is: #C70002

item.title: picoCTF2017 task 2
item.description:
picoCTF2017 task 2

[link—standalone]

the second task is of cryptography. this is the link.
i was supposed to decode a ROT13 text.
the code i used here is:

echo "Lb, fb unir lbh orra cynlvat gung arj Zrfbcrgf tnzr? Gubfr arj Zrtnybalpuvqnr naq Oenqlcbqvqnr gurl nqqrq ner cerggl pbby. Npghnyyl, V jbhyq tb nf sne nf fnlvat gung vg vf abj zl yvsr'f qrnerfg nzovgvba gb bognva n "Vasyngnoyr Fybgu Zbafgre"!" | tr '[A-Za-z]' '[N-ZA-Mn-za-m]'
the solution is:
Yo, so have you been playing that new Mesopets game? Those new Megalonychidae and Bradypodidae they added are pretty cool. Actually, I would go as far as saying that it is now my life's dearest ambition to obtain a Inflatable Sloth Monster!

item.title: picoCTF2017 task 1
item.description:
picoCTF2017 task 1

[link—standalone]

so it started out with me needing to use grep.
here it is. this is the link. i was supposed to find the full name, i.e. use grep.
cat contractors.txt | grep "^Robin" | grep "Morris$"
the answer is: Robin Almay Morris

item.title: This is what a post looks like
item.description:
This is what a post looks like

[link—standalone]

This is autogenerated by the blog. As you can see, an equivalent RSS feed entry and standalone blog post is generated after you finalize the post.
